channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Enhanced Latent Multi-view Subspace Clustering
item.description: Specifically, we stack the data matrices from various views into the block-diagonal locations of the augmented matrix to exploit the complementary information.

item.title: An Empirical Study on Compliance with Ranking Transparency in the Software Documentation of EU Online Platforms
item.description: Compliance with the European Union's Platform-to-Business (P2B) Regulation is challenging for online platforms, and assessing their compliance can be difficult for public authorities.

item.title: Inverse Transfer Multiobjective Optimization
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel concept of inverse transfer in multiobjective optimization.

item.title: PC-Conv: Unifying Homophily and Heterophily with Two-fold Filtering
item.description: This is attributed to their neglect of homophily in heterophilic graphs, and vice versa.

item.title: ViStripformer: A Token-Efficient Transformer for Versatile Video Restoration
item.description: Besides, ViStripformer is an effective and efficient transformer architecture with much lower memory usage than the vanilla transformer.

item.title: Attacking Byzantine Robust Aggregation in High Dimensions
item.description: Designing such aggregators is challenging when dealing with high dimensions.

item.title: Sharp error estimates for target measure diffusion maps with applications to the committor problem
item.description: Remarkably, we find that the TMDmap algorithm is particularly suited as a meshless solver to the committor problem due to the cancellation of several error terms in the prefactor formula.

item.title: Harnessing Diffusion Models for Visual Perception with Meta Prompts
item.description: Our key insight is to introduce learnable embeddings (meta prompts) to the pre-trained diffusion models to extract proper features for perception.

item.title: DuaLight: Enhancing Traffic Signal Control by Leveraging Scenario-Specific and Scenario-Shared Knowledge
item.description: Furthermore, we implement a scenario-shared Co-Train module to facilitate the learning of generalizable dynamics information across different scenarios.

item.title: Learning from higher-order statistics, efficiently: hypothesis tests, random features, and neural networks
item.description: Our results show that neural networks extract information from higher-order correlations in the spiked cumulant model efficiently, and reveal a large gap in the amount of data required by neural networks and random features to learn from higher-order cumulants.

item.title: Towards more sustainable enterprise data and application management with cross silo Federated Learning and Analytics
item.description: To comply with new legal requirements and policies committed to privacy protection, more and more companies start to deploy cross-silo Federated Learning at global scale, where several clients/silos collaboratively train a global model under the coordination of a central server.

item.title: Balancing the Style-Content Trade-Off in Sentiment Transfer Using Polarity-Aware Denoising
item.description: Text sentiment transfer aims to flip the sentiment polarity of a sentence (positive to negative or vice versa) while preserving its sentiment-independent content.

item.title: Joint Learning Neuronal Skeleton and Brain Circuit Topology with Permutation Invariant Encoders for Neuron Classification
item.description: Skeleton Encoder integrates the local information of neurons in a bottom-up manner, with a one-dimensional convolution in neural skeleton's point data; Connectome Encoder uses a graph neural network to capture the topological information of neural circuit; finally, Readout Layer fuses the above two information and outputs classification results.

item.title: Part to Whole: Collaborative Prompting for Surgical Instrument Segmentation
item.description: To address these challenges, in this paper, we investigate text promptable surgical instrument segmentation and propose SP-SAM (SurgicalPart-SAM), a novel efficient-tuning approach that integrates surgical instrument structure knowledge with the generic segmentation knowledge of SAM.

item.title: Automating the Design of Multigrid Methods with Evolutionary Program Synthesis
item.description: For this purpose, we develop a novel context-free grammar that enables the automated generation of multigrid methods in a symbolically-manipulable formal language, based on which we can apply the same multigrid-based solver to problems of different sizes without having to adapt its internal structure.

item.title: TACO: Topics in Algorithmic COde generation dataset
item.description: Moreover, each TACO problem includes several fine-grained labels such as task topics, algorithms, programming skills, and difficulty levels, providing a more precise reference for the training and evaluation of code generation models.

item.title: PUMA: Efficient Continual Graph Learning with Graph Condensation
item.description: Our prior work, CaT is a replay-based framework with a balanced continual learning procedure, which designs a small yet effective memory bank for replaying data by condensing incoming graphs.

item.title: Reasons to Reject? Aligning Language Models with Judgments
item.description: As humans, we consistently engage in interactions with our peers and receive feedback in the form of natural language.

item.title: SCUNet++: Assessment of Pulmonary Embolism CT Image Segmentation Leveraging Swin-UNet and CNN Bottleneck Hybrid Architecture with Multi-Fusion Dense Skip Connection
item.description: These findings demonstrate that our method exhibits strong performance in PE segmentation tasks, potentially enhancing the accuracy of automatic segmentation of PE and providing a powerful diagnostic tool for clinical physicians.

item.title: Federated Learning via Input-Output Collaborative Distillation
item.description: Federated learning (FL) is a machine learning paradigm in which distributed local nodes collaboratively train a central model without sharing individually held private data.

item.title: On the Effectiveness of Unlearning in Session-Based Recommendation
item.description: On the one hand, these approaches cannot achieve satisfying unlearning effects due to the collaborative correlations and sequential connections between the unlearning item and the remaining items in the session.

item.title: Token-Level Contrastive Learning with Modality-Aware Prompting for Multimodal Intent Recognition
item.description: To establish an optimal multimodal semantic environment for text modality, we develop a modality-aware prompting module (MAP), which effectively aligns and fuses features from text, video and audio modalities with similarity-based modality alignment and cross-modality attention mechanism.

item.title: FAST: Feature Aware Similarity Thresholding for Weak Unlearning in Black-Box Generative Models
item.description: The heightened emphasis on the regulation of deep generative models, propelled by escalating concerns pertaining to privacy and compliance with regulatory frameworks, underscores the imperative need for precise control mechanisms over these models.

item.title: Collaborative Synthesis of Patient Records through Multi-Visit Health State Inference
item.description: Furthermore, we propose to generate medical reports to add textual descriptions for each medical event, providing broader applications for synthesized EHR data.

item.title: A Multi-Stage Adaptive Feature Fusion Neural Network for Multimodal Gait Recognition
item.description: In this paper, by considering the temporal and spatial characteristics of gait data, we propose a multi-stage feature fusion strategy (MSFFS), which performs multimodal fusions at different stages in the feature extraction process.

item.title: Cross-Covariate Gait Recognition: A Benchmark
item.description: Compared to existing datasets, CCGR has both population and individual-level diversity.

item.title: SAVAE: Leveraging the variational Bayes autoencoder for survival analysis
item.description: As in many fields of medical research, survival analysis has witnessed a growing interest in the application of deep learning techniques to model complex, high-dimensional, heterogeneous, incomplete, and censored medical data.

item.title: A Language-based solution to enable Metaverse Retrieval
item.description: Recently, the Metaverse is becoming increasingly attractive, with millions of users accessing the many available virtual worlds.

item.title: An effective and efficient green federated learning method for one-layer neural networks
item.description: Federated learning (FL) is one of the most active research lines in machine learning, as it allows the training of collaborative models in a distributed way, an interesting option in many real-world environments, such as the Internet of Things, allowing the use of these models in edge computing devices.

item.title: Adaptive Differential Evolution with Diversification: Addressing Optimization Challenges
item.description: The existing variants of the Differential Evolution (DE) algorithm come with certain limitations, such as poor local search and susceptibility to premature convergence.

item.title: Global Occlusion-Aware Transformer for Robust Stereo Matching
item.description: Despite the remarkable progress facilitated by learning-based stereo-matching algorithms, the performance in the ill-conditioned regions, such as the occluded regions, remains a bottleneck.

item.title: Images in Discrete Choice Modeling: Addressing Data Isomorphism in Multi-Modality Inputs
item.description: We propose and benchmark two methodologies to address this challenge: architectural design adjustments to segregate redundant information, and isomorphic information mitigation through source information masking and inpainting.

item.title: DSAP: Analyzing Bias Through Demographic Comparison of Datasets
item.description: Often, these biases can be traced back to the data used for training, where large uncurated datasets have become the norm.

item.title: Quality-Diversity Generative Sampling for Learning with Synthetic Data
item.description: QDGS is a model-agnostic framework that uses prompt guidance to optimize a quality objective across measures of diversity for synthetically generated data, without fine-tuning the generative model.

item.title: Aurora:Activating Chinese chat capability for Mistral-8x7B sparse Mixture-of-Experts through Instruction-Tuning
item.description: This work is pioneering in the execution of instruction fine-tuning on a sparse expert-mixed model, marking a significant breakthrough in enhancing the capabilities of this model architecture.

item.title: PhysRFANet: Physics-Guided Neural Network for Real-Time Prediction of Thermal Effect During Radiofrequency Ablation Treatment
item.description: Radiofrequency ablation (RFA) is a widely used minimally invasive technique for ablating solid tumors.

item.title: Upper Bounding Barlow Twins: A Novel Filter for Multi-Relational Clustering
item.description: To overcome this drawback, we propose to learn a graph filter motivated by the theoretical analysis of Barlow Twins.

item.title: ElasticTrainer: Speeding Up On-Device Training with Runtime Elastic Tensor Selection
item.description: To speed up on-device training, existing schemes select trainable NN portion offline or conduct unrecoverable selection at runtime, but the evolution of trainable NN portion is constrained and cannot adapt to the current need for training.

item.title: DP-AdamBC: Your DP-Adam Is Actually DP-SGD (Unless You Apply Bias Correction)
item.description: The Adam optimizer is a popular choice in contemporary deep learning, due to its strong empirical performance.

item.title: Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation for Driving Scenes
item.description: Notably, the proposed method achieves 51. 8\% mIoU on the Cityscapes test dataset, showcasing its potential as a strong WSSS baseline on driving scene datasets.

item.title: Universal Noise Annotation: Unveiling the Impact of Noisy annotation on Object Detection
item.description: For object detection task with noisy labels, it is important to consider not only categorization noise, as in image classification, but also localization noise, missing annotations, and bogus bounding boxes.

item.title: A Semantic Space is Worth 256 Language Descriptions: Make Stronger Segmentation Models with Descriptive Properties
item.description: Instead of relying solely on category-specific annotations, ProLab uses descriptive properties grounded in common sense knowledge for supervising segmentation models.

item.title: Fine-tuning Graph Neural Networks by Preserving Graph Generative Patterns
item.description: In this paper, we identify the fundamental cause of structural divergence as the discrepancy of generative patterns between the pre-training and downstream graphs.

item.title: VCoder: Versatile Vision Encoders for Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: Secondly, we leverage the images from COCO and outputs from off-the-shelf vision perception models to create our COCO Segmentation Text (COST) dataset for training and evaluating MLLMs on the object perception task.

item.title: TinySAM: Pushing the Envelope for Efficient Segment Anything Model
item.description: We first propose a full-stage knowledge distillation method with online hard prompt sampling strategy to distill a lightweight student model.

item.title: HD-Painter: High-Resolution and Prompt-Faithful Text-Guided Image Inpainting with Diffusion Models
item.description: Recent progress in text-guided image inpainting, based on the unprecedented success of text-to-image diffusion models, has led to exceptionally realistic and visually plausible results.

item.title: Front stability of infinitely steep travelling waves in population biology
item.description: We establish the existence of travelling wave solutions for these two extensions, and then consider stability of the travelling wave solutions by introducing a lateral perturbation of the travelling wavefront.

item.title: Geo2SigMap: High-Fidelity RF Signal Mapping Using Geographic Databases
item.description: First, we develop an automated framework that seamlessly integrates three open-source tools: OpenStreetMap (geographic databases), Blender (computer graphics), and Sionna (ray tracing), enabling the efficient generation of large-scale 3D building maps and ray tracing models.

item.title: T-Eval: Evaluating the Tool Utilization Capability Step by Step
item.description: In contrast to previous works that evaluate models holistically, we comprehensively decompose the tool utilization into multiple sub-processes, including instruction following, planning, reasoning, retrieval, understanding, and review.

item.title: Neural Point Cloud Diffusion for Disentangled 3D Shape and Appearance Generation
item.description: However, none of the existing models enable disentangled generation to control the shape and appearance separately.
